title: Crafting the Client: The Play Loop

replies.body:
Heya!

Thanks for the praise! We are changing the user experience flow to make it more consistent across the client. This of course will create a learning curve for everyone used to the legacy client. I'll try to explain our thought process behind it. 

All "Play" related actions now start at the top left with the PLAY button which transforms into the LOBBY once you click it. The "menu" as you called it will be accessible by clicking NEWS (now ALPHA) next to the LOBBY button and will be the default screen players will see when they login to the client. You will also be able to change the game mode by pressing the ^ arrow below the LOBBY. Like you said, this may take a little getting used to and we'll continue to monitor feedback closely to make sure it feels natural.

This is really cool! However, I do have one question. Based on this video, it almost looks like the chat rooms have been removed. This would be a serious problem for [Factions](http://LeagueFactions.net), which depends heavily on chat rooms to organize matches.

For context: in Factions, Summoners are divided up among various factions, such as Demacia or Noxus. They then fight matches against each other using faction-specific rosters. Currently, people use the Factions chat to advertise matches that are being made, and to find Factioners who are online and willing to play.

Can you confirm whether or not chat rooms are being removed? If so, will there be some alternative community organizing system, like clubs?

I've always felt like you should be able to choose runes and masteries during the game loading screen, not just character select.

It would cut down drastically on people having the wrong runes because they ran out of time.

Though i understand this would be tricky to implement

Not just tricky, but impossible. Or at least incredibly impractical. All the data that is going to be used in the match has to be preloaded. That's what the loading screen is for: Loading all the map and character data into memory so it can run smoothly without having to be loaded during the actual game, which would cause significant delays. If you could change your runes and such during loading, it would have to not only reload that data, but the system would constantly have to respond to your input for changes and check for those changes, which would drastically slow things down. Haven't you noticed that pretty much no game in history lets you do anything while loading? There's a reason for that.

And seriously, you have TONS of time to pick your runes and masteries. Even if you are last pick, you STILL have 30 seconds to confirm them, not to mention the fact that you usually have a fair idea of who you're going to play before you actually lock in. If you have all the time in champ select plus at LEAST 30 seconds after last pick and you STILL go in with wrong runes/masteries/summoners, well... sorry, that's on you.
